title: Shenzhen HongKong Plaza
overview:
Qianhai Holdings intend to hold a competition starting in mid-December (provisional) for the development of the ULR, now renamed the Shenzhen Hong Kong Plaza.

This is reinforce the connection with HK and to ‘welcome’ as many visitors as possible.

 

On the 26th, I attended an EPR meeting (as one of the panel together with Huasen, CCDI, CR land and others) to listen and to comment on both a marketing strategy prepared by JLL and a technical analysis prepared by Huasen, the LDI responsible for coordinating infrastructure in the centrals Qianhai district.

The JLL presentation was much as expected (pages and pages of the usual bumf) and the Huasen analysis daunting in that, just as we expected, much of the basement infrastructure has been planned or even constructed. There are massive basement electrical sub stations which have also made a sudden appearance.

 

Despite huge challenges, the ‘leaders’ have ordained that the SHKP is definitely going to happen in one form or another - and have laid out an ambitious and probably unrealistic schedule as noted below.

 

BASIC INFORMATION

 

Note the phasing diagram below together with the relevant GFA attributable to each stage.

This diagram does not include the landscape component of 215,000 in Phase 1 and a further combined 100,000 in phases 2,3 and 4.

 

Phase 1 they want complete in 18 months

Phase 2 in 36 months

Phase 3 in 12 months (tis is Rocco’s trading plaza)

Phase 4 in 17 years (following the dismantling of Innotech).

 

Full service for phases 1,3 and 3 and SD only for Phase 4.

 

A one stop shop (JV)  including LDI and other consultants. Aube has agreed to join us. They can cover most disciplines and also have a huge landscape department. They were responsible for the waterside park adjacent to the CR Land HQ (the rocket ship) in Shenzhen.

 

Invited and paid competition to run for 50 days starting mid-December. Fee TBC
